label: WD-100
info_overview:
• Works with incandescent and dimmable florescent (CFL) or most LED lighting
  • 7 segment LED dim level indicator
  • Fits into standard single or multiple gang junction box
  • Over-The-Air firmware upgrade available with compatible gateway, Z-Wave static controller, or PC and software
  • Internal resettable fuse to protect from surge current
  • Manual reset capability
  • Support Central Scene
info_inclusion: Â single click and release the rocker switch
info_exclusion: single click and release the rocker switch.

category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Orientation
parameters.description: Controls the on/off orientation of the rocker switch

parameters.label: Remote dim level increment
parameters.description: Number of dim levels to change for each dim step when remotely commanded

parameters.label: Remote dim step duration
parameters.description: Interval between dimming steps when remotely commanded

parameters.label: Dim Level Increment
parameters.description: Indicates the number of levels (1-99) to change dimming each step

parameters.label: Step Duration
parameters.description: The number of tens of milliseconds (1-255) to delay on each dimming step.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

xml.xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<ProductExport xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <Id>2299</Id>
  <Name>In-Wall Dimmer Switch</Name>
  <Description>- Works with incandescent and dimmable florescent (CFL) or most LED lighting
- 7 segment LED dim level indicator
- Fits into standard single or multiple gang junction box
- Over-The-Air firmware upgrade available with compatible gateway, Z-Wave static controller, or PC and software
- Internal resettable fuse to protect from surge current
- Manual reset capability
- Support Central Scene
</Description>
  <Description_Short>WD-100 In Wall Dimmer Switch
- Replaces existing wall switch 
- Remotely or manually turns On, Off, or dim lights 
- Fits standard wall plates 
- Z-Wave Plus certified with 500 series chipset 
- Functions as a Z-Wave signal repeater
- Support Central Scene</Description_Short>
  <Brand>Z Wave Products Inc.</Brand>
  <Identifier>WD-100</Identifier>
  <CertificationNumber>ZC10-17035505</CertificationNumber>
  <OemVersion>HW: 255 FW: 5.17</OemVersion>
  <HardwarePlatform>ZM5202</HardwarePlatform>
  <ZWaveVersion>6.51.08</ZWaveVersion>
  <LibraryType>Enhanced 232 Slave</LibraryType>
  <DeviceType>Light Dimmer Switch</DeviceType>
  <RoleType>Always On Slave</RoleType>
  <ManufacturerId>0x0315</ManufacturerId>
  <ProductTypeId>0x4447</ProductTypeId>
  <ProductId>0x3034</ProductId>
  <FrequencyName>U.S./Canada/Mexico</FrequencyName>
  <UserIcon>0x0600</UserIcon>
  <InstallerIcon>0x0600</InstallerIcon>
  <ProductUrl />
  <SupportUrl />
  <ManualUrl>http://Products.Z-WaveAlliance.org/ProductManual/File?folder=&filename=Manuals/2299/ZWP_WD100_UG_030217.pdf</ManualUrl>
  <InclusionDescription>1. Turn the connected lights ON/OFF by tapping the switch. Tapping and releasing the upper part of the rocker turns the appliance ON. Tapping and releasing the lower part of the rocker turns the appliance OFF.
2. Add(Include) the module to/from your Z-Wave network with your primary controller. Please refer to the instructions manual of your gateway or remote controller for details and procedures on how these actions can be done. 
3. Normally, the sequence is as follows: when the inclusion process is prompted by your primary controller, single click and release the rocker switch to ON or OFF position.  The controller should show that the action was successful.  If the controller shows it was a fail, repeat the procedure.</InclusionDescription>
  <ExclusionDescription>1. Turn the connected appliance ON/OFF by tapping the switch. Tapping and releasing the upper part of the rocker turns the appliance ON. Tapping and releasing the lower part of the rocker turns the appliance OFF.
2. Delete(Exclude) the module to/from your Z-Wave network with your primary controller. Please refer to the instructions manual of your gateway or remote controller for details and procedures on how these actions can be done. 
3. Normally, the sequence is as follows: when the exclusion process is prompted by your primary controller, single click and release the rocker switch.  The controller should show that the action was successful. If the controller shows it was a fail, repeat the procedure.</ExclusionDescription>
  <LearnModeDescription />
  <ResetDescription>Please use this procedure only in the event that the network primary controller is lost or otherwise inoperable.

All Configuration Parameters can all be restored to their factory default settings by using your primary controller to delete/reset the device.  
To manually reset, tap the ON button twice quickly and then tap the OFF button twice quickly.  Repeat the procedure to restore the settings to the factory default.

</ResetDescription>
  <WakeupDescription />
  <OtherSpecialFeaturesDescription>Z-Wave Plus introduces a new process for scene activation â âCentral Scene 
Controlâ. Press and release the button, it will send a certain command to the central controller via the lifeline association group 1. This allows the controller to react to key pressed, key released and key held down.

-	Press and release the top button, âScene 001 Key Pressedâ preset by the Gateway will be turned ON.
-	Press the top button twice, âScene 001 Key Pressed Twiceâ preset by the Gateway will be turned ON.
-	Press the top button 3 times, âScene 001 Key Pressed 3 Timesâ preset by the Gateway will be turned ON.
-	Press and release the bottom button, âScene 002 Key Pressedâ preset by the Gateway will be turned ON.
-	Press the bottom button twice, âScene 002 Key Pressed Twiceâ preset by the Gateway will be turned ON.
-	Press the bottom button 3 times, âScene 002 Key Pressed 3 Timesâ preset by the Gateway will be turned ON.
</OtherSpecialFeaturesDescription>
  <CertificationApprovedDate>2017-03-23T22:15:05.546949</CertificationApprovedDate>

    </AssociationGroupExport>
  </AssociationGroups>
  <ConfigurationParameters>
    <ConfigurationParameterExport>
      <Name>indicates the time duration of each level</Name>
      <Description>The time interval of brightness change between dimming up and down can be adjusted

Valid Values: 1-255 (default = 3), indicates the time duration of each level.</Description>
      <ParameterNumber>10</ParameterNumber>
      <Size>2</Size>
      <DefaultValue>3</DefaultValue>
      <pType>0</pType>
      <flagReadOnly>false</flagReadOnly>
      <flagReInclude>false</flagReInclude>
      <flagAdvanced>false</flagAdvanced>
      <v3plus>false</v3plus>
      <minValue>0</minValue>
      <maxValue>0</maxValue>
      <ConfigurationParameterValues>
        <ConfigurationParameterValueExport>
          <From>1</From>
          <To>255</To>
          <Description>indicates the time duration of each level.</Description>
        </ConfigurationParameterValueExport>
      </ConfigurationParameterValues>
    </ConfigurationParameterExport>
    <ConfigurationParameterExport>
      <Name>the orientation of the ON/OFF on the rocker switch</Name>
      <Description>the orientation of the ON/OFF on the rocker switch can be inverted </Description>
      <ParameterNumber>4</ParameterNumber>
      <Size>1</Size>
      <DefaultValue>0</DefaultValue>
      <pType>0</pType>
      <flagReadOnly>false</flagReadOnly>
      <flagReInclude>false</flagReInclude>
      <flagAdvanced>false</flagAdvanced>

      <maxValue>0</maxValue>

        <ConfigurationParameterValueExport>

          <To>1</To>
          <Description>the connected light will turn OFF by pressing the top side of the rocker switch and turn ON by pressing the bottom side.</Description>
        </ConfigurationParameterValueExport>
        <ConfigurationParameterValueExport>
          <From>0</From>
          <To>0</To>
          <Description>the connected light will turn ON by pressing the top side of the rocker switch and turn OFF by pressing the bottom side. </Description>
        </ConfigurationParameterValueExport>
      </ConfigurationParameterValues>
    </ConfigurationParameterExport>
    <ConfigurationParameterExport>
      <Name>turning On or Off the lights via remote control </Name>
      <Description>Turning On or Off the lights via remote control 
Valid Values: 1-99 (default = 1), indicates the number of levels when the light is controlled by remote.  Lower this number, the finer the control of dimming. Higher the number the faster the dimming </Description>
      <ParameterNumber>7</ParameterNumber>
      <Size>1</Size>
      <DefaultValue>1</DefaultValue>

      </ConfigurationParameterValues>
    </ConfigurationParameterExport>
    <ConfigurationParameterExport>
      <Name>turning On or Off the lights via remote control or scheduled program</Name>
      <Description>Turning On or Off the lights via remote control or scheduled program
Valid Values: 1-255 (default = 3), indicates the time duration of each level when the light is controlled by remote</Description>
      <ParameterNumber>8</ParameterNumber>

    <ConfigurationParameterExport>
      <Name>indicates the number of levels</Name>
      <Description>The time interval of brightness change between dimming up and down can be adjusted

Length: 1 Byte
Valid Values: 1-99 (default = 1), indicates the number of levels the lighting will change when the timer runs out. 
</Description>
